name: elf-cms
description: ELF (Enterprise Content Management Framework) - A powerful CMS for building custom web apps with dynamic pages, cloud functions, database explorer, and developer tools. Supports SQLite/MySQL with Docker deployment.

scripts.start: npm run start:node && npm run start:php
scripts.start:bg: npm run start:node:bg && sleep 1 && npm run start:php:bg && sleep 1 && echo 'Servers started in background'
scripts.stop: npm run stop:node && npm run stop:php
scripts.stop:node: if [ -f api/nodejs-server.pid ]; then kill $(cat api/nodejs-server.pid) 2>/dev/null || true; rm -f api/nodejs-server.pid; echo 'Node.js server stopped'; else echo 'Node.js server PID file not found'; fi
scripts.stop:php: lsof -ti:8000 | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || true; echo 'PHP server stopped'
scripts.restart: npm run stop && sleep 1 && npm run start:bg
scripts.status: echo '=== Server Status ===' && if [ -f api/nodejs-server.pid ] && kill -0 $(cat api/nodejs-server.pid) 2>/dev/null; then echo "Node.js: Running (PID: $(cat api/nodejs-server.pid))"; else echo 'Node.js: Not running'; fi && if [ ! -z "$(lsof -ti:8000 2>/dev/null)" ]; then echo "PHP: Running (PID: $(lsof -ti:8000 | head -1))"; else echo 'PHP: Not running'; fi
